sentences.sContent: She’s struggling to cope with the heavy workload .
sentences.sCn: 她在努力应付繁重的工作量。

sentences.sContent: ...The 83% of American employees who are stressed about their jobs--up from 73% just a year before--say that poor compensation and an unreasonable workload are their number-one sources of stress...

words.tran: 日常的，工作日的；平凡的
工作；影响；受雇用（work的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: the amount of work that a person or organization has to do
